Key Match Events: The Pistons outscored Charlotte 14-12 in the fourth quarter
Charlotte started the fourth quarter by missing 11 of their first 12 shots and committing five turnovers
Detroit continued to foul but Charlotte only made two of their first seven free throws in the quarter
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pistons played their first game since Jaden Ivey broke his left leg in Wednesday's win over Orlando
As expected, Malik Beasley got most of the playing time, scoring 12 points in 31 minutes
Others: The Pistons were down 47-46 with 4:45 left in the second quarter, and Charlotte went on an 11-2 run before Bridges ended the half with a 30-foot 3-pointer to make it 65-52. The Pistons came back to outscore the Hornets 32-17 in the third quarter

Even though Charlotte was forced to foul three times in the final minute, they still only committed 10 fouls to Detroit’s 27. However, they weren’t able to take advantage, missing 11 of 30 free throws
